result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Arnold N Mitchell

records.addlTxt: ***ALSO $7,500.00 SIGNATURE BOND*** Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the victim S.D. (person, property, residence or family). It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

9:00 AM Defendant Arnold N Mitchell in court, in custody.  Attorney David Patton in court for Arnold N Mitchell.  Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. 
Matter converted to bail/bond hearing based on motion filed. 
Defense indicates they have an investigator looking in to the case and gives statement as to why they are asking bond be modified. 
State objects to modification of bond and gives statement as to why. 
Defense responds. 
BTC: BOND MODIFICATION: Court will modify bond $2500 cash bond with $7500 signature bond.
Status conference scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on December 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing on October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

9:08 AM Defendant Arnold N Mitchell in court, in custody.  Attorney David Patton in court for Arnold N Mitchell.  Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.
Status conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the victim S.D. (person, property, residence or family). It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

1:40 PM Defendant Arnold N Mitchell appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez appeared by video for Arnold N Mitchell.  Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
